steps.name: basics
steps.label: Basics
steps.description: This template will deploy an Azure Local lab environment or an HCI lab environment on a single Azure virtual machine.

location.label: Region
location.toolTip: Specify the region to deploy your lab environment.

elements.name: vmName
elements.label: Lab host VM name
elements.toolTip: Specify your lab host virtual machine resource name. The name used as an Azure resource identifier for it, not used for the computer name of the guest operating system.

validations.message: Virtual machine name can contain all alphanumeric characters and '-', also, not begin with '-' and not end with '-'.
Virtual machine name must be between 1 and 64 characters long.

elements.name: vmSize
elements.label: Size
elements.toolTip: Specify the size for your lab host virtual machine.

options.text:
128 GiB memory is the real minimum when you deploy any workloads on your Azure Local instance/HCI cluster. You may need more memory if you deploy hybrid services on your Azure Local instance/HCI cluster because this lab environment has multiple Hyper-V VMs such as HCI servers, an AD domain controller and a management server on a single Azure Virtual machine.
  • Azure Virtual Machine sizes
  • Windows Virtual Machines pricing
Specify the administrator account credentials. The credentials are used for the local administrator account and the domain administrator account in your lab environment.

elements.name: adminUserName
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Specify the administrator username.

options.text: Save up to 49% with a license you already own using Azure Hybrid Benefit.

elements.name: isUseExistingWindowsServerLicense
elements.label: Would you like to use an existing Windows Server license?

elements.name: hasEligibleWindowsServerLicense
elements.label: I confirm I have an eligible Windows Server license with Software Assurance or Windows Server subscription to apply this Azure Hybrid Benefit.

options.text: Deployment will take about 30 to 90 minutes depending on your deployment options.

steps.name: labHostStep
steps.label: Lab host
steps.description: Configure details for your lab host. The lab host is an Azure virtual machine.

elements.name: osDiskType
elements.label: OS disk type
elements.toolTip: You can select Azure managed disks type based on your workload or scenario.

allowedValues.label: Premium SSD (LRS)
allowedValues.description: Best for production and performance sensitive workloads. Locally-redundant storage (data is replicated within a single datacenter).

allowedValues.label: Standard SSD (LRS)
allowedValues.description: Best for web servers, lightly used enterprise applications and dev/test. Locally-redundant storage (data is replicated within a single datacenter).

allowedValues.label: Standard HDD (LRS)
allowedValues.description: Best for backup, non-critical, and infrequent access. Locally-redundant storage (data is replicated within a single datacenter).

elements.name: dataDiskType
elements.label: Data disk type
elements.toolTip: You can select Azure managed disks type based on your workload or scenario.

allowedValues.label: Premium SSD (LRS)
allowedValues.description: Best for production and performance sensitive workloads. Locally-redundant storage (data is replicated within a single datacenter).

allowedValues.label: Standard SSD (LRS)
allowedValues.description: Best for web servers, lightly used enterprise applications and dev/test. Locally-redundant storage (data is replicated within a single datacenter).

options.text: All lab assets and artifacts such as VMs, VHDs, ISOs are stored in a single data volume on the lab host. The data volume capacity cannot change after finish deployment.

elements.name: dataDiskSize

elements.toolTip: Data volume capacity on your lab host virtual machine.

elements.label: Join to the AD domain
elements.toolTip: Select whether or not the HCI servers are to be joined to the AD domain.

options.text: Please skip this page because not applicable to Azure Local deployment.

steps.name: mgmtServerStep
steps.label: Management server
steps.description: Server management tools to manage Azure Local instances, HCI clusters, Active Directory and more are installed on the management server.

options.text: Windows Admin Center is a remote management tool for Windows Server. Learn more
HCI Lab supports Windows Admin Center installation. But it is temporary disabled. You can install Windows Admin Center manually after HCI Lab deployment finished.
